resources.string: The Guide to Munich and Bavaria
Events
Castles
Food and Party
Places to go
Chinese Tower Beer Garden
The best known beer garden in Bavaria
Englischer Garten 3, 80538 München, Germany
A place to have a beer and pretzels in the wonderful English garden.
Open all year round, if weather permits.
Hofbräuhaus
There\'s no more Bavarian place for food and drink
Platzl 9, 80331 München, Germany
A place for tourists, for sure, but also for the locals
Open every day from 9:30 AM to 11:30 PM
Christmas Markets
Traditional food and sweets, mulled wine, and lots of ambiente
Marienplatz 26, 80331 München, Germany
Munich has a rich tradition of Christkindlmarkets.
To recommend one, the Christkindlmarket at the Marienplatz is easy to reach and provides anything a visitor could want - November 23 to December 24
Oktoberfest
The world famous festival
Theresienwiese
Canceled for 2020, but the tradition will be back.
Maybe the most famous element is the beer, but there is so much more to it
Summer Tollwood
Music, market, food, drinks, party
Olympiapark
The summer event with music, markets etc. Ecological gastronomy, art and fantastic bands. An event for everyone.
The Winter Tollwood takes place on the Theresienwiese, where the Oktoberfest takes place in fall.
Free and Easy Festival
A festival full of free events
Reitknechtstr. 6, 80639 Munich
Lots of musical acts at the Backstage, from mid July to early August
Known for cheap beer and good atmosphere, it\'s a good opportunity to check out new bands.
Neuschwanstein
Fairy tale castle built by a crazy king? We got you covered
Neuschwansteinstraße 20, 87645 Schwangau, Germany
Probably the best known German castle and definitely worth a visit.
Once considered an economic blunder, this castle ist now considered one of Bavaria\'s greatest treasures.
Linderhof Palace
Another castle of the crazy king. This one comes with an artificial grotto
Linderhof 12, 82488 Ettal, Germany
A bit more than an hour ride from Munich. Beautiful landscaping.
The smallest of the three palaces built by Ludwig II of Bavaria.
Royal Palace of Herrenchiemsee
This one is a copy of the palace in Versailles
83209 Herrenchiemsee, Germany
About 40 miles from Munich, this palace of Ludwig II is located on an island in lake Chiemsee.
Only the central building and the garden were ever finished, the copy of Versailles was supposed to pay hoomage to Louis XIV of France.
Englischer Garten
A beautiful, enormous park in the middle of the city
Train station Giselastraße
This enormous park is always an inviting place for a stroll, all year round.
Due to its size there are many ways to get there, but the train station Giselastraße is a good start. Else ask anybody, they will know how to get there.
Olympiapark
Location of the 1972 Olympic Summer Games
Spiridon-Louis-Ring 21, 80809 München, Germany
The architecture of the main stadium is just stunning.
In addition to sport events, this area is used for cultural events and of course for nice walks in the park.
Watzmann
The third highest mountain in Germany
83471 Schönau am Königssee
2 hours South-East of Munich, one of the most impressive mountain vistas in Bavaria
For hikers, climbers and all kinds of visitors a location that will leave a lasting impression.
